Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, makes the annexed Controlled Substances Regulations under subsection 55(1)a of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Actb.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act. (Loi)
adult means an individual who is 18 years of age or older. (adulte)
advertisement includes any representation by any means for the purpose of promoting, directly or indirectly, the sale or other disposal of a controlled substance. (publicité)
cannabis offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under subsection 9(1) or (2), 10(1) or (2), 11(1) or (2), 12(1), (4), (5), (6) or (7), 13(1) or 14(1) of the Cannabis Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraph (a). (infraction relative au cannabis)

Definition.Text: CAS registry number means the identification number assigned to a chemical by the Chemical Abstracts Service, a division of the American Chemical Society. (numéro d’enregistrement CAS)

competent authority means a public authority of a foreign country that is authorized under the laws of that country to approve the importation or exportation of controlled substances into or from that country. (autorité compétente)
container means an immediate container of a controlled substance, unless otherwise specified, but does not include a collection container. (contenant)
controlled drug means a substance set out in Schedule 2. (drogue contrôlée)
destroy, in relation to a controlled substance, means to alter or denature it to such an extent that its consumption is rendered impossible or improbable. (destruction)
drug identification number means the identification number assigned to a drug under paragraph C.01.014.2(1)(a) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (identification numérique)

emergency medical service vehicle means any conveyance authorized under the laws of a province to transport individuals to hospitals and on which emergency medical services are provided. (véhicule de service médical d’urgence)

emergency supply means a controlled substance that is stored in a place that is either in a remote area where emergency medical treatment is not readily available or in an emergency medical service vehicle. (approvisionnement d’urgence)

finished product means a finished product that contains a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, that is in a form that is intended to be administered to an individual or animal and, in the case of a finished product that does not contain a restricted drug, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a drug identification number; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is compounded by a pharmacist or pharmacy technician in accordance with these Regulations. (produit fini)

Definition.Text: government laboratory means a forensic or toxicology laboratory that is operated by the government of Canada or of a province and in which analytical testing involving controlled substances is conducted. (laboratoire public)

health professional means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise a profession in a health care field and who is practising in that province. (professionnel de la santé)
hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated by a province under the laws of the province to provide health care or treatment to individuals or animals; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is owned or operated by the government of Canada or of a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: intern means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to work as an intern in a health care field, or to work under a designation that the Minister considers equivalent, and who is working as such in that province. (stagiaire)

international obligation means an obligation relative to a controlled substance set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres. (obligation internationale)
letter of authorization means the letter of authorization issued under section C.08.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations. (lettre d’autorisation)
licensed dealer means the holder of a licence issued under subsection 12(1). (distributeur autorisé)
midwife means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise midwifery and who is practising midwifery in that province. (sage-femme)
mixture means a mixture that contains a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, but does not include a finished product. (mélange)
narcotic means a substance set out in Schedule 1. (stupéfiant)

nurse practitioner means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise as a nurse practitioner or to practise under an equivalent designation and who is practising as such in that province. For the purposes of this definition, a designation is equivalent when it designates an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a registered nurse;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possesses additional training and experience related to health care; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: can autonomously make diagnoses, request diagnostic tests and interpret their results, prescribe drugs and perform other specific procedures under the laws of a province. (infirmier praticien)

Definition.Text: order does not include a prescription. (commande)

particular person means a person that, in the course of that person’s operations, unexpectedly receives a controlled substance from an individual for the purposes of destruction. (personne particulière)
peace officer has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Criminal Code. (agent de la paix)

person in charge of a government laboratory means an individual who has responsibility for managing all of a government laboratory’s activities with respect to controlled substances. (responsable d’un laboratoire public)
person in charge of a hospital means an individual who has responsibility for managing all of a hospital’s activities with respect to controlled substances. (responsable d’un hôpital)
pharmacist means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and who is practising pharmacy in that province. (pharmacien)

pharmacy technician means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise as a pharmacy technician or to practise under a designation that the Minister considers equivalent and who is practising as such in that province. (technicien en pharmacie)
podiatrist means an individual who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise podiatry or chiropody and who is practising podiatry or chiropody in that province. (podiatre)

prescription means an authorization given by a practitioner that a stated amount of a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, be sold or provided for the individual named or the animal identified in it. (prescription)
qualified person in charge means the individual designated under subsection 9(1). (responsable qualifié)
restricted drug means a substance that is set out in Schedule 4. (drogue d’utilisation restreinte)

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances and Drugs Containing Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (Directive en matière de sécurité)
send does not include sending by mail. (expédition)
senior person in charge means the individual designated under section 8. (responsable principal)
specialized in destruction, in relation to a licensed dealer, describes a dealer whose licence specifies that it only deals in the destruction of controlled substances. (spécialisé en destruction)
targeted substance means a substance set out in Schedule 3. (substance ciblée)
test kit means a kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains a controlled substance and an adulterating or denaturing agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is used to test for a controlled substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended or likely to be consumed by, or administered to, an individual or animal. (trousse d’essai)

Subsection.Text: For the application of these Regulations, a controlled substance refers to any of the following substances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a restricted drug.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the definition practitioner in subsection 2(1) of the Act, the following persons are prescribed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: midwives;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: nurse practitioners; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: podiatrists.

Section.Text: The following persons are exempt from the application of these Regulations if, in respect of their activity, they are exempt from the application of sections 5 to 7.1 of the Act by virtue of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Police Enforcement) Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a member of a police force, as defined in section 1 of those regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person acting under the direction and control of that member.

Section.Text: The Act and these Regulations do not apply in respect of a finished product that contains a controlled drug set out in Part 3 of Schedule 2 and that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a form that allows the sustained release of an active ingredient over a certain period of time; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intended for insertion under the skin of a food-producing animal for the purpose of increasing weight gain and improving feed efficiency.

Section.Text: An agent or mandatary of a person, including an employee of that person or another person that is acting under a contract with that person, may conduct an activity if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the person,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is authorized under these Regulations to conduct the activity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the provincial professional regulatory authority of the province in which they are practising does not prohibit the delegation of the activity to the agent or mandatary; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the agent or mandatary,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, they are authorized by the provincial professional regulatory authority of the province in which they are practising to conduct the activity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the agent or mandatary does so as part of their role as agent or mandatary or their employment duties and functions or in the performance of their contract, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the agent or mandatary complies with the requirements that apply to the person referred to in paragraph (a).

Heading.TitleText: Controlled Drugs, Narcotics and Targeted Substances

Subsection.Text: A person referred to in subsection (2) is authorized to possess any of the following controlled substances if the person has obtained the substance in accordance with these Regulations, in the course of acts conducted in connection with the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation or from a person exempted under subsection 56(1) of the Act from the application of subsection 5(1) of the Act with respect to that controlled substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a narcotic set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled drug set out in Part 1 of Schedule 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a targeted substance set out in Part 1 of Schedule 3.

Subsection.Text: An authorized person is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person that conducts an activity, with respect to the controlled substance, that is necessary for their business or the practice of their profession and that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist or pharmacy technician, other than one who is practising in a hospital, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the province in which they possess the controlled substance, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a province other than the province in which they possess the controlled substance, if they possess the substance for emergency medical purposes only;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector, member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, peace officer or member of the technical or scientific staff of the federal government, a provincial government or a university in Canada who possesses the controlled substance in connection with their employment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a particular person that possesses the substance for the purposes of destruction; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has obtained the controlled substance for their own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal in accordance with a prescription that was issued or obtained in accordance with these Regulations from one of the following persons:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a practitioner, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a pharmacist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has imported the controlled substance

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: for their own use,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: for the use and on the behalf of an accompanying individual, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: for an animal for which the individual is responsible and that is accompanying the individual.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary — person in paragraph (2)(d)
Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a person referred to in paragraph (2)(d) may only have a controlled substance set out in subsection (1) in their possession if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they have reasonable grounds to believe that person is a person referred to in paragraph (2)(d); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they possess the controlled substance for the purpose of assisting that person in the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer, the Minister, a government laboratory or an individual referred to in section 226 may possess a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, for the purpose of exporting it if the substance was obtained in accordance with these Regulations.

The following persons are authorized to possess any restricted drug listed in Part 1 of Schedule 4 if that person has obtained the drug in accordance with these Regulations or in the course of acts conducted in connection with the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist or pharmacy technician, other than one who is practising in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner who is named in a letter of authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector, member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, peace officer or member of the technical or scientific staff of the federal government, a provincial government or a university in Canada who possesses the restricted drug in connection with their employment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a particular person that possesses the substance for the purposes of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who has obtained the restricted drug for their own use from a practitioner named in a letter of authorization.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary — person in paragraph (1)(e)
Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a person referred to in paragraph (1)(e) may only have a restricted drug listed in Part 1 of Schedule 4 in their possession if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they have reasonable grounds to believe that person is a person referred to in paragraph (1)(e); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they possess the restricted drug for the purpose of assisting that person in the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer, the Minister or a government laboratory may possess a restricted drug for the purpose of exporting it if the drug was obtained in accordance with these Regulations.
Persons referred to in subsection (2) are required to obtain a dealer’s licence for each site at which that person intends to conduct one of the following activities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: producing a controlled substance, unless the person doing so is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist or pharmacy technician who is compounding a finished product in accordance with these Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a government laboratory;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: packaging, selling, providing, delivering, sending or transporting a controlled substance, unless the person doing so is:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist or pharmacy technician who is not practising in a hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a government laboratory,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a particular person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual referred to in section 223 or 224;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: importing or exporting a controlled substance, unless the person doing so is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a government laboratory, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual referred to in section 225 or 226; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: destroying a controlled substance, if that is the only activity that the person intends to conduct.

Subsection.Text: The persons that are eligible to obtain a dealer’s licence are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an organization that has its head office in Canada or operates a branch office in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a position that includes responsibility for controlled substances on behalf of the government of Canada or of a province, a police force, a hospital or a university in Canada.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual, who may be the applicant if the applicant is an individual, as the senior person in charge who has overall responsibility for management of the activities with respect to controlled substances that are specified in the licence application.

Only an individual who has sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that are applicable to the activities specified in the licence application to properly carry out their duties may be designated as a senior person in charge.

An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual, who may be the applicant if the applicant is an individual, as the qualified person in charge who is responsible for supervising the activities with respect to controlled substances that are specified in the licence application and for ensuring that those activities comply with these Regulations, as well as with any terms or conditions of the licence and any permit issued under these Regulations.

An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual, who may be the applicant if the applicant is an individual, as an alternate qualified person in charge who is authorized to replace the qualified person in charge when that person is absent.
Only an individual who meets the following requirements may be designated as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they work at the site specified in the dealer’s licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential awarded by a post-secondary educational institution in Canada in a field or occupation that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, chemistry, biology, pharmacy technician, laboratory technician, pharmaceutical regulatory affairs or supply chain management or security, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential that is awarded by a foreign educational institution in a field or occupation referred to in subparagraph (i) and hold one of the following assessments that establishes the equivalency of the diploma, certificate or credential to one of the documents referred to in that subparagraph:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment as defined in subsection 73(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment issued by an institution or organization that is responsible for issuing equivalency assessments and is recognized by a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of and experience with the use and handling of the controlled substances specified in the dealer’s licence application to properly carry out their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that are applicable to the activities specified in the dealer’s licence application to properly carry out their duties.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual who does not meet any of the requirements set out in paragraph (3)(b) as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no other individual working at the site meets those requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: those requirements are not necessary for the activities specified in the licence application; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individual has sufficient knowledge acquired from any combination of education, training and work experience to properly carry out their duties.

Subsection.Text: An individual is not eligible to be a senior person in charge, a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if, during the 10 years before the day on which the dealer’s licence application is submitted,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a designated substance offence, a cannabis offence or any other offence referred to in subsection (2), the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: was a young person who received an adult sentence, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated substance offence, a cannabis offence or any other offence referred to in subsection (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they committed the offence when they were at least 14 years old but less than 18 years old, the individual received a sentence that was longer than the maximum youth sentence, as that term is defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act, that could have been imposed under that Act for such an offence.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the other offences are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving the financing of terrorism referred to in any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving fraud referred to in any of sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime referred to in section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving a criminal organization referred to in any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d).

Subsection.Text: An application to obtain a dealer’s licence must be submitted to the Minister and must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual, the individual’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an organization, the name by which it intends to identify itself or under which it intends to conduct the activities specified in the licence application and, if applicable, its corporate name and any other name registered with a province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of a position described in paragraph 7(2)(c), the applicant’s name and the title of the position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of the site specified in the licence application and, if different from the municipal address, its mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth, telephone number and email address of the proposed senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to each of the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, date of birth, telephone number and email address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the title of their position at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and title of the position of their immediate supervisor at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the profession they practise that is relevant to their duties, the name of the province that authorizes them to practise it and their authorization number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: their education, training and work experience that are relevant to their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are to be conducted and the controlled substance in respect of which each of the activities is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested in order to produce or package a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, for each substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, its CAS registry number, if any, as well as its form, the quantity that the applicant intends to produce under the licence and the period during which that quantity would be produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be produced or packaged for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, and if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address and licence number of the other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested to produce or package a mixture or finished product, for each mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be produced or packaged by or for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, and if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address and licence number of the other licensed dealer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant’s name appears on any label, as defined in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act, of the finished product, a copy of that label;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested for an activity that is not described in paragraph (f) or (g), the name of the controlled substance for which the activity is to be conducted and the purpose of the activity;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the security measures in place at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the method of recording information that the applicant proposes to use for the purposes of section 86.

Subsection.Text: The application must be accompanied by the following documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is an organization, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which its site is located that states the name by which it intends to identify itself or under which it intends to conduct the activities specified in the licence application and, if applicable, its corporate name and any other name registered with a province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the permit or licence that is issued by the municipality in which its site is located that authorizes the business to operate, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: individual declarations, signed and dated by each of the proposed senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge, attesting that the signatory is not ineligible for a reason specified in section 10;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force or by a business that is accredited by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police in relation to each person referred to in paragraph (b) indicating whether, during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the person was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the persons referred to in paragraph (b) has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, a document issued by a police force of that country indicating whether in that period that person was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge, attesting that they have the knowledge required under subsection 8(2) and that the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge have the knowledge and experience required under paragraphs 9(3)(c) and (d);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the proposed qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge, a copy of their diploma, certificate or credential referred to in paragraph 9(3)(b) and, if applicable, the equivalency assessment referred to in subparagraph 9(3)(b)(ii); and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the proposed qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge does not meet the requirement set out in paragraph 9(3)(b), a detailed description of the education, training and work experience that is required under paragraph 9(4)(c), together with supporting documents, such as a copy of a course transcript or an attestation by the person who provided the training.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 14, on completion of the review of the licence application, the Minister must issue a dealer’s licence, with or without terms and conditions, that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed dealer is an individual, their name and, if applicable, title, or if the licensed dealer is an organization, the name by which it intends to identify itself or under which it intends to conduct the activities specified in the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specified activities and, for each activity, the name of the controlled substance that is set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4 or that is contained in a mixture or finished product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the site at which the activity is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the security level at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the licence, which must not be later than three years after its effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level that is referred to in paragraph (e), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed dealer produces a controlled substance that is set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, the quantity that the licensed dealer may produce and the production period.

Subsection.Text: A person must not alter or deface in any manner a dealer’s licence.

Section.Text: A dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 32 or 33.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not meet the requirement set out in subsection 7(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence application is submitted, the applicant has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the applicant under any regulations made under the Act or issued to the applicant under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a narcotic, an activity for which the licence is requested is the cultivation, propagation or harvesting of opium poppy other than for scientific purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph 11(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required under section 86;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has not provided the Minister with the information or documents required under subsection 11(4) or before the date specified in the written request referred to in that subsection, or the information or documents that the applicant has provided before that date are not sufficient to complete the review of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a peace officer, a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has been involved in the diversion of a controlled substance to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravenes an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to issue a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (i) if the applicant meets the following conditions unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have a history of non-compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue a licence, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the applicant with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the applicant’s submissions, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: To apply to renew a dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the information and documents referred to in subsections 11(1) and (2).
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 18, on completion of the review of the renewal application, the Minister must issue a renewed dealer’s licence that contains the information specified in subsection 12(1).

When renewing a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete a term or condition in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the licence renewal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: A renewed dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 32 or 33.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to renew a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer no longer meets the requirement set out in subsection 7(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the renewal is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a narcotic, an activity for which the renewal is requested is the cultivation, propagation or harvesting of opium poppy other than for scientific purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the renewal is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph 11(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required under section 86;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not provided the Minister with the information or documents required under subsection 15(3) or by the date specified in the written request referred to in that subsection, or the information or documents that the dealer has provided before that date are not sufficient to complete the review of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a peace officer, a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a controlled substance to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the renewal of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to renew a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (i) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to renew a licence, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the licensed dealer with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: Before making a change affecting any information that is contained in their dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application to amend the licence that contains a description of the proposed amendment, as well as the information and documents referred to in subsections 11(1) and (2) that are relevant to the proposed amendment.
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 22, on completion of the review of the amendment application, the Minister must amend the dealer’s licence.

When amending a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete a term or condition in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the amendment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: An amended dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 32 or 33.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to amend a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer no longer meets the requirement set out in subsection 7(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the amendment application is submitted, the senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the amendment is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a narcotic, an activity for which the amendment is requested is the cultivation, propagation or harvesting of opium poppy other than for scientific purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the amendment is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph 11(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required under section 86;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not provided the Minister with the information or documents required under subsection 19(3) or before the date specified in the written request referred to in that subsection, or the information or documents that the dealer has provided before that date are not sufficient to complete the review of the amendment application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the amendment application; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the amendment of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to amend a licence under paragraph (1)(h) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to amend a licence, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the licensed dealer with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Heading.TitleText: Changes Requiring Prior Approval by the Minister

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must obtain the Minister’s approval before making any of the following changes by submitting a written application to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change affecting the method of recording information referred to in paragraph 11(1)(j);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the qualified person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement or addition of an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must provide the Minister with the following with respect to a change referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence or the method of recording information referred to in paragraph 11(1)(j), details of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a replacement of the senior person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 11(1)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents specified in paragraphs 11(2)(b) to (e); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a replacement of the qualified person in charge or a replacement or addition of an alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 11(1)(d), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents specified in paragraphs 11(2)(b) to (f).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 25, on completion of the review of the application for approval of the change, the Minister must approve the change.

When approving a change, the Minister may, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to the licence or modify or delete a term or condition in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to approve the change if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application for approval of the change is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not provided the Minister with the information or documents required under subsection 23(3) or before the date specified in the written request referred to in that subsection, or the information or documents that the dealer has provided before that date are not sufficient to complete the review of the application for approval of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for approval of the change; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the change would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to approve a change under paragraph (1)(c) if the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
Before refusing to approve a change, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the licensed dealer with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Heading.TitleText: Changes Requiring a Notice to the Minister

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: producing or packaging a mixture or finished product that is not set out in the most recent update of the information and label referred to in paragraph 11(1)(g); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: making a change to a mixture or finished product that is set out in that most recent update, if the change affects any of the information or label that has previously been submitted.

Subsection.Text: The notice must contain the information that is necessary to update the information or label referred to in paragraph 11(1)(g) and must be accompanied by a document containing all the information referred to in that paragraph, including those updates, and a copy of the label referred to in that paragraph or, if applicable, a copy of the updated label.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within five days after a person ceases to act as the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within 10 days after one of the following changes occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person ceases to act as the senior person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to produce or package a mixture or finished product that is set out in the most recent update of the information and label referred to in paragraph 11(1)(g).

Subsection.Text: A notice concerning a change referred to in paragraph (1)(b) must contain the information that is necessary to update the information referred to in paragraph 11(1)(g) and must be accompanied by a document containing all the information referred to in that paragraph, including those updates, and a copy of the label for any other controlled substance.

A licensed dealer that intends to cease conducting activities at their site — whether on or before the expiry of their licence — must notify the Minister in writing to that effect at least 30 days before ceasing those activities.
The notice must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of the cessation of activities at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the manner in which any remaining controlled substances on the site as of that date will be disposed of by the licensed dealer, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will be conducting activities at the same site, their name and, if applicable, title,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will not be conducting activities at the same site, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address of their site, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be destroyed, the anticipated date of destruction and the municipal address of the place at which the destruction is to be carried out;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place at which the licensed dealer’s documents will be kept after activities have ceased; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of a person whom the Minister may contact for further information after activities have ceased.

Subsection.Text: After having ceased to conduct the activities, the licensed dealer must submit to the Minister a detailed update of the information referred to in subsection (2) if it differs from what was set out in the notice. The update must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge.

Heading.TitleText: Changes to the Terms and Conditions of a Licence

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, at any time other than at the issuance, renewal or amendment of a dealer’s licence, add or modify a term or condition if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before adding a term or condition to, or modifying a term or condition of, a licence, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the licensed dealer with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), the Minister may immediately add a term or condition to, or modify a term or condition of, a licence, subject to subsection (4), if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The addition or modification of a term or condition that is made under subsection (3) takes effect as soon as the Minister provides the licensed dealer with a written notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the addition or modification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may delete a term or condition of a dealer’s licence that the Minister determines is no longer necessary.
The deletion takes effect as soon as the Minister provides the licensed dealer with a written notice to that effect.

Heading.TitleText: Suspension and Revocation of a Licence

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must immediately suspend a dealer’s licence in respect of any activities in relation to any controlled substance if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister provides the licensed dealer with a written notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the authorized activity and controlled substance that are the subject of the suspension, as well as the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the licence if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer no longer meets the requirement set out in subsection 7(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the licence or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to conduct activities at their site before the expiry of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not take the corrective measures specified in an undertaking or notice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence is revoked, the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or any alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 10(1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of an application relating to the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a peace officer, a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a controlled substance to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke a dealer’s licence for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking a licence, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the licensed dealer with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each importation of a controlled substance, an application for an import permit that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their dealer’s licence number and their business registration number assigned by the Minister of National Revenue;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the proposed customs broker for the licensed dealer, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation is anticipated and the proposed date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address, in the country of export, of the exporter from whom the controlled substance is being obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the carrier that is proposed to transport the controlled substance to the customs office where the importation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its CAS registry number, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its form,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its purity and anhydrous content, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that, to the best of their knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the importation does not contravene the laws of the country of exportation or any country of transit or transhipment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 37, on completion of the review of the import permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an import permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in subsection 34(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A person must not alter or deface in any manner an import permit.

Section.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 40 or 41,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section 32 or 33, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the expiry, suspension or revocation of the export authorization that applies to the controlled substance to be imported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of export.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to import the relevant controlled substance or their licence will expire before the date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of the importation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not provided the Minister with the information or documents required under subsection 34(3) or before the date specified in the written request referred to in that subsection, or the information or documents that the dealer has provided before that date are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue an import permit, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the licensed dealer with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of importation.

The holder of an import permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of release of the controlled substance specified in the permit in accordance with the Customs Act, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and, if applicable, title;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their dealer’s licence number and the number of the import permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister provides the licensed dealer with a written notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the import permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
The Minister must revoke an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence has been revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph 40(2)(c) by the specified date; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted misleading information or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit.

Paragraph.Label: (a)

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the licensed dealer’s submissions, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each exportation of a controlled substance, an application for an export permit that contains the following information and document:

Paragraph.Text: the name of the carrier that is proposed to transport the controlled substance from the customs office where the exportation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (h)

Subsection.Text: The application must

Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the import authorization issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A person must not alter or deface in any manner an export permit.

Section.Text: An export permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 48 or 49,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the expiry, suspension or revocation of the import authorization that applies to the controlled substance to be exported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination.

Heading.TitleText: Authorizations and General Conditions Applicable to Activities

Section.Text: A licensed dealer may conduct the following activities if it does so in accordance with their dealer’s licence and any permit issued under these Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produce a controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a controlled substance to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: another licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
