Subparagraph.Text: with the exception of a restricted drug, a pharmacist, other than one who is practising in a hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: with the exception of a restricted drug, a hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a person exempted under subsection 56(1) of the Act with respect to that controlled substance, if there are terms and conditions for the sale or provision by a licensed dealer that are specified in the exemption,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a government laboratory;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transport, send or deliver a controlled substance; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: import or export a controlled substance.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that packages a controlled substance may only do so in accordance with their dealer’s licence issued under these Regulations.
A licensed dealer specialized in destruction that destroys a controlled substance may only do so in accordance with their dealer’s licence issued under these Regulations.
A licensed dealer may conduct an activity in relation to a controlled substance at their site only if the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge is present at the site.

A licensed dealer must include their name, as set out in their dealer’s licence, on all the means by which it identifies itself in regard to their activities in relation to a controlled substance, including labels, shipping documents, invoices and advertising.

A licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any relevant information or document to demonstrate their compliance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations.

A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance to another licensed dealer may only do so if it first receives from the other licensed dealer a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other licensed dealer placing the order, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer selling or providing the controlled substance, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance sold or provided for the purposes of destruction, a statement to that effect.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance to a pharmacist may only do so if it first receives from the pharmacist a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must not sell or provide to the pharmacist a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the pharmacist’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.

A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a practitioner may only do so if it first receives from the practitioner a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a restricted drug to a practitioner may only do so if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer first receives a letter of authorization in which it is named;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner is named in the letter of authorization and the municipal address of the place where they practise is specified in that letter; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer sells or provides the restricted drug only in the quantity specified in the letter of authorization and, if applicable, in the form and strength specified in that letter.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must not sell or provide to the practitioner a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the practitioner’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance to a hospital may only do so if it first receives from the hospital a written order that is signed and dated by a person permitted to place an order on the hospital’s behalf and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital, its name and municipal address, as well as the name and title of the person placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance to a person exempted under subsection 56(1) of the Act with respect to that substance may only do so in accordance with the terms and conditions for the sale or provision by the licensed dealer that are specified in the exemption and if it first receives from the exempted person a copy of that exemption.

A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance to the Minister may only do so if it first receives from the Minister a written order that is signed and dated on the Minister’s behalf and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the individual signing the order, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance is to be delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address and licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance to a government laboratory may only do so if it first receives from the government laboratory a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the government laboratory, its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address and licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, may do so more than once in respect of one order, within six months after the order was made, if the order indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of sales or provisions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the specific quantity for each sale or provision; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the intervals between each sale or provision.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may sell or provide a controlled substance more than once in respect of one order if, at the time of receipt of the order, the dealer temporarily does not have in stock the quantity of the substance ordered, in which case the dealer may sell or provide the quantity of the substance that the dealer has available and sell or provide the balance later.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that receives an order from a person for a controlled substance must verify the person’s name and, if applicable, their title as well as their signature if it is not known to the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer that takes delivery of a controlled substance that it has imported or that delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance to another person may only do so if it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensures that its outermost container is inconspicuous, without any mark identifying its contents, and sealed in such a manner that the container cannot be opened without breaking the seal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensures that all inner containers are sealed in such a manner that they cannot be opened without breaking the seal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: takes all reasonable measures to ensure the security of the controlled substance while it is being delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: uses a method of delivery, sending or transportation that ensures the tracking of the controlled substance until the consignee receives it;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported controlled substance, delivers, sends or transports it directly to the site specified in their licence after it is released under the Customs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance that is to be exported, delivers, sends or transports it directly from the site specified in their licence to the customs office where it will be exported.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a test kit that has a registration number.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must take all reasonable measures to ensure the security of any controlled substance, licence or permit in their possession.

Section.MarginalNote: Loss or theft — licences and permits
Section.Text: If a licensed dealer becomes aware of a loss or theft of their licence or permit, the dealer must provide a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of the loss or theft.

Section.MarginalNote: Loss or theft — agent or mandatary

Subsection.Text: If an agent or mandatary of a licensed dealer becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, the agent or mandatary must notify the licensed dealer immediately.

If a licensed dealer becomes aware of a loss of a controlled substance that cannot be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities, or of a theft of a controlled substance, or is notified by an agent or mandatary of such a loss or theft, the dealer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a loss, provide a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware or being notified of the loss; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a theft, provide

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written report to a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware or being notified of the theft, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware or being notified of the theft, including a confirmation that the report required under subparagraph (i) has been provided.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must provide a written report containing the following information to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of a transaction occurring in the course of their activities that it has reasonable grounds to suspect may be related to the diversion of a controlled substance to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an individual, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address and telephone number, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an organization, its name, municipal address and telephone number, as well as the title of the position held by the individual making the report;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other party to the transaction, their name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details of the transaction, including its date and time, as well as its type;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the reasons for the dealer’s suspicions.

Subsection.Text: No civil proceedings lie against a licensed dealer for having provided the report in good faith.
A licensed dealer must not disclose that it has provided the report or disclose details of it with the intent to prejudice a criminal investigation, whether or not a criminal investigation has begun.

Section.Text: A report provided under any of sections 67 to 69, or any evidence derived from it, is not to be used or received to incriminate the licensed dealer or their agent or mandatary in any criminal proceeding against them other than a prosecution under section 132, 136 or 137 of the Criminal Code.
A licensed dealer that intends to destroy a controlled substance at the site specified in their licence must ensure that the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer obtains the prior approval of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in the presence of two of the following persons, at least one of whom must be a person referred to in subparagraph (i):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person who works for or provides services to the licensed dealer and holds a senior position;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as the destruction is completed, the person who carried out the destruction and each of the two persons referred to in paragraph (b) who were present at the destruction sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the controlled substance was destroyed, to which each signatory must add in printed letters their name and, if applicable, title.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that intends to destroy a controlled substance elsewhere than at the site specified in their licence must ensure that the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer obtains the prior approval of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer takes all reasonable measures to ensure the security of the controlled substance while it is being transported in order to prevent its diversion to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out by a person working for a business that specializes in the destruction of dangerous goods, other than a licensed dealer specialized in destruction, and in the presence of another person working for that business;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as the destruction is completed, the person who carried out the destruction provides the licensed dealer with a dated declaration attesting that the controlled substance was destroyed and containing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: subject to clause (D), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: subject to clause (D), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: subject to clause (D), its drug identification number, if any, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction to a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner, hospital or particular person, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the names, in printed letters, and signatures of the person who carried out the destruction and the other person who was present at the destruction.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the following information in order to obtain the Minister’s approval to destroy a controlled substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a brief description of the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the destruction is to be carried out at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, the names of the persons proposed for the purposes of paragraph 71(b) and information establishing that they meet the conditions of that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction to a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner, hospital or particular person, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed method of destruction complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Text: On completion of the review of the approval application, the Minister must approve the destruction of the controlled substance unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a destruction that is to be carried out at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, the persons proposed for the purposes of paragraph 71(b) do not meet the conditions of that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the controlled substance would not be destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the approval application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the controlled substance or a portion of it is required for the purposes of a criminal or administrative investigation or a preliminary inquiry, trial or other proceeding under any Act or its regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the approval would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that the controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that orders or receives a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and, if applicable, title of the individual placing the order for the controlled substance or receiving it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person from whom the controlled substance is ordered or received, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order or receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction to a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner, hospital or particular person, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and, if applicable, title of the individual selling or providing the controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person to whom the controlled substance is sold or provided, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale or provision;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance that is a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that produces or packages a controlled substance must record the following information with respect to the substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, its brand name, as well as the name and quantity of the controlled substance it uses to produce the mixture or finished product, or that is contained in the mixture or finished product that it packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that stores a controlled substance must record the following information with respect to the substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it is placed in stock;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction to a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner, hospital or particular person, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that receives a written order for a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and, if applicable, title of the individual receiving the order; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order and the date on which it was received.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance to another person must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an agent or mandatary of the dealer delivers, sends or transports the controlled substance, their name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other person, their name and, if applicable, title;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance will be delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the delivery, sending or transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that imports a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the exporter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the country of exportation and any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that exports a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the exportation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the importer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the country of final destination and any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that becomes aware of a loss of a controlled substance that can be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities or that is notified by their agent or mandatary of such a loss, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the dealer became aware or was notified of the loss;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the explanation for the loss.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that destroys a controlled substance at the site specified in their licence must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and, if applicable, title of the person who carried out the destruction and of the other persons who were present at the destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction to a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner, hospital or particular person, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a licensed dealer must provide to the Minister, within 15 days after the end of each month, a monthly report that contains the name and quantity of each controlled substance

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4 that the licensed dealer receives, produces, packages, sells, provides, imports, exports or destroys during the month;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is contained in a mixture or finished product that the licensed dealer receives, packages, sells, provides, imports, exports or destroys during the month or that the dealer has used to produce a mixture or finished product during the month;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is in the physical inventory taken at the site specified in their licence at the end of the month; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that has been lost in the course of conducting activities during the month and whose loss can be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities.

Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer’s licence expires without being renewed or is revoked, the dealer must provide to the Minister, within three months after the expiration or revocation, a report in respect of the portion of the month during which the licence was valid that contains the information referred to in subsection (1), in which the quantity in physical inventory is to be calculated as of the date of expiry or revocation.

Heading.TitleText: Recording Information and Retention and Provision of Documents

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that records any information under these Regulations must do so using a method that permits an audit of it to be made at any time.
A licensed dealer and a former licensed dealer must keep

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any document containing the information that it is required to record under these Regulations for two years after the day on which the last record is recorded in the document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: every written order, in sequence as to date and number, for two years after the day on which it is received; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: every declaration, report and letter of authorization for two years after the day on which it is provided or received.

Section.Text: The documents must be accessible

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the site specified in the licensed dealer’s licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a document retained by a former licensed dealer, at a place in Canada.

Section.Text: The documents must be complete and readily retrievable and the information in them must be legible and indelible.
A licensed dealer and a former licensed dealer must provide any documents that the Minister requests in the time and manner that the Minister specifies.

For the purposes of sections 92 to 126, the terms pharmacist, pharmacy technician and intern, as defined in subsection 1(1), are to be read as excluding those who are practising in a hospital, except as otherwise provided.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a licensed dealer if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensed dealer is specialized in destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacist first receives from that licensed dealer specialized in destruction a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other controlled substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the following conditions is met:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the licensed dealer is the one that sold or provided that controlled substance to the pharmacist, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the sale or provision is for the purposes of testing or destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacist first receives from the licensed dealer a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a restricted drug to a licensed dealer if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the restricted drug was previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is specialized in destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist first receives from that licensed dealer specialized in destruction a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: The information that must be contained in the written order is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance sold or provided for the purposes of destruction, a statement to that effect.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a pharmacist may, in the case of an emergency, sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to another pharmacist if they first receive from the other pharmacist either a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information or a verbal order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other pharmacist placing the order, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist selling or providing the controlled substance, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration from the other pharmacist that they require the controlled substance for emergency purposes.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may, in circumstances other than an emergency, sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to another pharmacist if they do so for the purpose of fulfilling a prescription received at the pharmacy where the other pharmacist practises or if the pharmacy where they practise is ceasing its operations and if they first receive from the other pharmacist a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other pharmacist placing the order, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist selling or providing the controlled substance, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where the sale or provision is conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist must not sell or provide to the other pharmacist a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the other pharmacist’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.

A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a practitioner if they first receive from the practitioner a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information or, in the case of an emergency, either such a written order or a verbal order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist must not sell or provide to the practitioner a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the practitioner’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a hospital if they first receive from the hospital a written order that is signed and dated by a person permitted to place an order on the hospital’s behalf and that contains the following information or, in the case of an emergency, either such a written order or a verbal order from such a person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital, its name and municipal address, as well as the name and title of the person placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a person exempted under subsection 56(1) of the Act with respect to that controlled substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist first receives from the exempted person a copy of the exemption;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: there are terms and conditions for the sale or provision by the pharmacist that are specified in the exemption; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sale or provision is carried out in accordance with those terms and conditions.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled substance to the Minister if they first receive from the Minister a written order that is signed and dated on the Minister’s behalf and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the individual signing the order, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance is to be delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled substance to an individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale or provision is for the individual’s own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the controlled substance is in the form of a finished product that does not contain a restricted drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), the pharmacist first receives the following in respect of the controlled substance from one of the following persons:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of the individual, a written prescription,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of another pharmacist or a pharmacy technician,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a written prescription, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a copy of the document on which the information with respect to a verbal prescription has been recorded under section 117, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a practitioner, a written or verbal prescription.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Finished product containing low dose of codeine
Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide, without a prescription, a finished product containing codeine phosphate to an individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the finished product contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a finished product in solid form, not more than 8 mg or its equivalent of codeine phosphate per unit, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a finished product in liquid form, not more than 20 mg or its equivalent of codeine phosphate per 30 mL;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the finished product contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: two additional medicinal ingredients other than a narcotic in a quantity of not less than the regular minimum single dose for one such ingredient or one-half of the regular minimum single dose for each such ingredient, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: three additional medicinal ingredients other than a narcotic in a quantity of not less than the regular minimum single dose for one such ingredient or one-third of the regular minimum single dose for each such ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist has reasonable grounds to believe that the finished product will only be used for recognized medical purposes; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist ensures that the following caution or its equivalent is conspicuously and legibly printed on the finished product’s inner label and outer label, as those terms are defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations:

Provision.Text: “This product contains codeine and should not be administered to children except on the advice of a physician, dentist or nurse practitioner.”

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician may compound a finished product, other than one containing a restricted drug, if they do so for the purpose of fulfilling a prescription and if they first receive the following with respect to the finished product from one of the following persons:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an individual, a written prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of another pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (2) or, in the case of an emergency, either such a written order or a verbal order,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a written prescription, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the document on which the information with respect to a verbal prescription is recorded under section 117;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of another pharmacy technician,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written prescription, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the document on which the information with respect to a verbal prescription is recorded under section 117;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are not practising in a hospital, a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (2) or, in the case of an emergency, either such a written order or a verbal order, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a written or verbal prescription; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a hospital, a written order that is signed and dated by a person permitted to place an order on the hospital’s behalf and that contains the information set out in subsection (2) or, in the case of an emergency, either such a written order or a verbal order from such a person.

Subsection.Text: The information that must be contained in the written order is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person placing the order,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of another pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a hospital, its name and municipal address, as well as the name of the person permitted to place the order on its behalf;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist or pharmacy technician compounding the finished product, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, a declaration from the other pharmacist that they require the finished product for emergency purposes.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who sells or provides a controlled substance or who compounds a finished product may, before the sale, provision or compounding, substitute a controlled substance for another controlled substance identified in a prescription, if the pharmacist is authorized to do so under the laws of the province where the sale, provision or compounding takes place.
A pharmacist may extend a prescription if the new expiration date of the extended prescription is not later than two years after the day on which the pharmacist received the prescription.
A pharmacist or pharmacy technician may transfer a prescription to another pharmacist or pharmacy technician if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they transfer it within two years after the day on which the prescription was received; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they provide

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance prescribed in writing, the written prescription, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance prescribed verbally, a copy of the document on which the information with respect to that verbal prescription is recorded under section 117.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who receives an order or prescription from a person for a controlled substance must verify the person’s name and, if applicable, their title as well as their signature if it is not known to the pharmacist.

A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who receives a controlled substance from an individual for the purposes of destruction must keep the substance in a collection container that is in a secure location to which only persons whom the pharmacist or technician has authorized have access and that is marked in a manner that is sufficient to identify the container.
A pharmacist must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any controlled substance is stored in a secure location at the place where they practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: only persons whom the pharmacist has authorized have access to that secure location.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician may deliver, send or transport a controlled substance.
A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance to another person may only do so if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, if the controlled substance is being delivered, sent or transported to a licensed dealer specialized in destruction, the substance is placed in a container that is sealed in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal and is marked in a manner sufficient to identify the container;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: take all reasonable measures to ensure the security of the controlled substance while it is being delivered, sent or transported; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: use a method of delivery, sending or transportation that ensures the tracking of the controlled substance until the consignee receives it.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician must take all reasonable measures to ensure the security of any controlled substance in their possession.

Section.MarginalNote: Loss or theft — agent or mandatary

Subsection.Text: If an agent or mandatary of a pharmacist becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, the agent or mandatary must notify the pharmacist immediately.

If a pharmacist becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, or is notified by an agent or mandatary of such a loss or theft, the pharmacist must provide a written report to the Minister within 10 days after the day on which they become aware of the loss or theft or are notified.

The report, or any evidence derived from it, is not to be used or received to incriminate the pharmacist or their agent or mandatary in any criminal proceeding against them other than a prosecution under section 132, 136 or 137 of the Criminal Code.
The destruction of a controlled substance in a pharmacy may only be carried out by a pharmacist or pharmacy technician and if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is witnessed by another person among the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, pharmacy technician or intern, including one who is practising in a hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other health professional;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: immediately following the destruction, the person who carried out the destruction and the witness sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the controlled substance was destroyed, to which each signatory must add their name in printed letters.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist must, if the destruction of a controlled substance previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction was not carried out, sell or provide the substance to a licensed dealer specialized in destruction.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who orders a controlled substance or a pharmacist or pharmacy technician who receives a controlled substance, other than one that has been previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person from whom the controlled substance is ordered or received, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order or receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.MarginalNote: Substances sold — persons other than individuals
Section.Text: A pharmacist who sells or provides a controlled substance to a person, other than an individual referred to in section 113, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale or provision;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the reason for the emergency sale or provision.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who sells or provides a finished product to an individual for their own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual who is named in the prescription or who is responsible for the animal identified in the prescription and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription, as well as the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale or provision;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the number of times that the prescription may be refilled and, if specified, the intervals between refills.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who compounds a finished product must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual who is named in the prescription or who is responsible for the animal identified in the prescription and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription, as well as the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of compounding the finished product; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who substitutes a controlled substance for another controlled substance identified in a prescription must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the original prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the substitution;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the controlled substance identified in the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the substitute controlled substance.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who receives a written order for a controlled substance or a written prescription from a practitioner must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s or pharmacy technician’s name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order or prescription and the date on which it was received.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who receives a verbal order for a controlled substance or a verbal prescription must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person placing the order or issuing the prescription,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an order from another pharmacist,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a declaration from the other pharmacist that they require the controlled substance for emergency purposes,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a prescription or order from a practitioner,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if it is an order, a declaration from the practitioner that they require the controlled substance for emergency purposes, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an order from a hospital,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its name and municipal address, as well as the name of the person permitted to place the order on its behalf, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a declaration from that person that the hospital requires the controlled substance for emergency purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of receipt of the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the number of refills authorized in the prescription and, if specified, the interval between refills.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who refills or extends a prescription must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the original prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the prescription refill or extension; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the new expiration date of the extended prescription.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who transfers a prescription to another pharmacist or pharmacy technician must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other pharmacist or pharmacy technician, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the prescription transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the last refill of the prescription and, if applicable, the number of authorized refills remaining and, if specified, the interval between refills; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the date of the prescription extension and the new expiration date of the extended prescription.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist or pharmacy technician who receives the transferred prescription must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist or pharmacy technician from whom they receive the transferred prescription, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of receipt of the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the last refill of the prescription and, if applicable, the number of authorized refills remaining and, if specified, the interval between refills; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the date of the prescription extension and the new expiration date of the extended prescription.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an agent or mandatary of the pharmacist delivers, sends or transports the controlled substance, their name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled substance is delivered, sent or transported to another person, the following information with respect to that person:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is not a person referred to in subparagraph (ii), their name and, if applicable, title, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are an individual who is named in a prescription or who is responsible for an animal identified in a prescription, their name and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance is delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the delivery, sending or transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who destroys a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the witness to the destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name, as well as the name of the controlled substance it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual or particular person for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Heading.TitleText: Recording Information and Retention and Provision of Documents

Section.Text: A pharmacist or pharmacy technician who records any information under these Regulations must do so using a method that permits an audit of it to be made at any time.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who is responsible for the operations of a pharmacy where the information was recorded under these Regulations or, if a pharmacy ceases its operations, the person who was responsible for those operations on the date those operations ceased must, subject to subsection (2), ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any document containing the information that must be recorded under these Regulations is kept for two years after the day on which the last record is recorded in the document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: every written order and prescription is kept, in sequence as to date and number, for two years after the day on which it is received; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: every declaration and report is kept for two years after the day on which it is provided or received.

Subsection.Text: All documents regarding the sale or provision of a controlled substance must be kept separately, in sequence as to date and number.

Section.Text: The documents must be accessible

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the pharmacy where the information was recorded; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that pharmacy has ceased its operations, at a place in Canada.

Section.Text: The documents must be complete and readily retrievable and the information in them must be legible and indelible.

A pharmacist who is responsible for a pharmacy’s operations or, if a pharmacy has ceased its operations, the person who was responsible for those operations on the date those operations ceased must provide any documents that the Minister requests in the time and manner that the Minister specifies.
A practitioner may issue a written prescription that they sign and date or a verbal prescription if
