Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner is treating, in their professional capacity, the individual for whom, or the animal for which, the prescription is issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the controlled substance set out in the prescription is needed to treat the individual’s or animal’s medical condition.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner may sell or provide a controlled substance to a licensed dealer if,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensed dealer is specialized in destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the practitioner first receives from that licensed dealer specialized in destruction a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other controlled substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the following conditions is met:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the licensed dealer is the one that sold or provided that controlled substance to the practitioner, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the practitioner sells or provides the controlled substance for the purposes of testing or destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the practitioner first receives from the licensed dealer a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: The information that must be contained in the written order is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance sold or provided for the purposes of destruction, a statement to that effect.

Section.Text: A practitioner may sell or provide a controlled substance to the Minister if they first receive from the Minister a written order that is signed and dated on the Minister’s behalf and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the individual signing the order, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance is to be delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to an individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale or provision is for the individual’s own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner first issues a written prescription for the individual for whom, or the animal for which, the controlled substance is sold or provided.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner may sell or provide a restricted drug to an individual for their own use if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner is treating the individual in their professional capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner has received a copy of the letter of authorization in which they are named.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner may administer a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to an individual or animal if the practitioner first issues a written prescription.
A practitioner may administer a restricted drug to an individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner is treating the individual in their professional capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner has received a copy of the letter of authorization in which they are named.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who is responsible for an emergency supply must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the emergency supply does not contain a restricted drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they have an agent or mandatary who is present at the place where the emergency supply is stored and who will, under their direction, administer the controlled substance under their control.

Subsection.Text: In an emergency, the agent or mandatary of the practitioner of medicine may administer a controlled substance from the emergency supply to an individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner of medicine has directed the agent or mandatary to administer the controlled substance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the agent or mandatary follows written directives provided by the practitioner of medicine with respect to the administration of the controlled substance.

Section.Text: A practitioner who receives a controlled substance from an individual for the purposes of destruction must keep the substance in a collection container that is in a secure location to which only persons whom the practitioner has authorized have access and that is marked in a manner that is sufficient to identify the container.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a practitioner who stores a controlled substance must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they store the controlled substance in a secure location in the place where they practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: only persons whom the practitioner has authorized have access to that secure location.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who stores an emergency supply need only ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they take all reasonable measures to ensure that the place of storage is secure; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: only the practitioner of medicine and their agent or mandatary have access to that secure place.

Section.Text: A practitioner may deliver, send or transport a controlled substance.
A practitioner who delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance to another person may only do so if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that, if the controlled substance is being delivered, sent or transported to a licensed dealer specialized in destruction, the substance is placed in a container that is sealed in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal and is marked in a manner that is sufficient to identify the container;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: take all reasonable measures to ensure the security of the controlled substance while it is being delivered, sent or transported; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: use a method of delivery, sending or transportation that ensures the tracking of the controlled substance until the consignee receives it.

Section.Text: A practitioner must take all reasonable measures to ensure the security of any controlled substance in their possession.

Section.MarginalNote: Loss or theft — agent or mandatary

Subsection.Text: If an agent or mandatary of a practitioner becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, the agent or mandatary must notify the practitioner immediately.

If a practitioner becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, or is notified by an agent or mandatary of such a loss or theft, the practitioner must provide a written report to the Minister within 10 days after the day on which they become aware of the loss or theft or are notified.

The report, or any evidence derived from it, is not to be used or received to incriminate the practitioner or their agent or mandatary in any criminal proceeding against them other than a prosecution under section 132, 136 or 137 of the Criminal Code.
The destruction of a controlled substance may be carried out by a practitioner only if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is witnessed by another person among the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, pharmacy technician or intern,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other health professional;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: immediately following the destruction, the person who carried out the destruction and the witness sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the controlled substance was destroyed, to which each signatory must add their name in printed letters.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner may, without a witness, destroy the remainder of a controlled substance that is contained in an open ampule and that will not be administered.

A practitioner must, if the destruction of a controlled substance previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction was not carried out, sell or provide the substance to a licensed dealer specialized in destruction.

Section.Text: The requirements set out in sections 141 to 152 apply to a practitioner with respect to the following controlled substances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the practitioner is not practising in a hospital, a narcotic, controlled drug or targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a restricted drug.

Section.Text: A practitioner who receives a controlled substance, other than one that has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person from whom the controlled substance is received, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.MarginalNote: Substances sold — persons other than individuals
Section.Text: A practitioner who sells or provides a controlled substance to a person, other than an individual referred to in section 143, must record

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner’s name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale or provision;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Section.MarginalNote: Substances prescribed, administered or sold — individuals

Subsection.Text: A practitioner who conducts the following activities must record the information set out in subsection (2):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescribe or administer a controlled substance to an individual or an animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a controlled substance to an individual for their own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal.

Subsection.Text: The information that must be recorded is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner’s name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual who is named in the prescription or who is responsible for the animal identified in the prescription and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an administration, sale or provision of a restricted drug to an individual, their name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the prescription, administration, sale or provision;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product that is sold or provided, other than one containing a restricted drug, is intended for administration by the individual to themselves or the animal, and if the dose exceeds the following, a statement to that effect:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the case of a finished product containing a controlled drug or narcotic, three times the maximum daily dosage recommended by the producer of the product or, if the producer has not recommended a maximum daily dosage, three times the generally recognized maximum daily therapeutic dosage for that product, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a finished product containing a targeted substance, five times the usual daily dose for the product.

Section.Text: A practitioner of medicine who is responsible for an emergency supply must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of their agent or mandatary administering the controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the place where the emergency supply is stored;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of all activities related to that emergency supply; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if a controlled substance was administered to an individual, the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the individual,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A practitioner who receives a written order must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order and the date on which it was received.

Section.Text: A practitioner who delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an agent or mandatary of the practitioner delivers, sends or transports the controlled substance, their name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled substance is delivered, sent or transported to another person, the following information with respect to that person:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are an individual who is named in a prescription or who is responsible for an animal identified in a prescription, their name and, if applicable, the name of the animal,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are a consignee of a restricted drug, their name, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, their name and, if applicable title;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance is delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the delivery, sending or transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Section.Text: A practitioner who destroys a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the witness to the destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4, its name and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iii), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iii), its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Heading.TitleText: Recording Information and Retention and Provision of Documents

Section.Text: A practitioner who records any information under these Regulations must do so using a method that permits an audit of it to be made at any time.

A practitioner who is responsible for the operations of a place where information was recorded under these Regulations or, if information was recorded at a place where operations have ceased, the person who was responsible for those operations on the date those operations ceased must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any document containing the information that they are required to record under these Regulations is kept for two years after the day on which the last record is recorded in the document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: every written order and prescription is kept, in sequence as to date and number, for two years after the day on which it is received or issued respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: every declaration, report and letter of authorization is kept for two years after the day on which it is provided or received.

Section.Text: The documents must be accessible

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the place where the information was recorded; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if operations have ceased at that place, at a place in Canada.

Section.Text: The documents must be complete and readily retrievable and the information in them must be legible and indelible.

A practitioner who is responsible for the operations of the place where the information was recorded or, if operations have ceased at a place where information was recorded, the person who was responsible for those operations on the date those operations ceased must provide any documents that the Minister requests in the time and manner that the Minister specifies.

In addition to meeting any other requirements set out in these Regulations, the following practitioners who, in accordance with these Regulations and subject to section 154, conduct any activity with respect to a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, may only do so if they are authorized by the provincial professional regulatory authority to conduct that activity:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a midwife;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a podiatrist; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a nurse practitioner.

Section.Text: A midwife or podiatrist must not possess or conduct any activity with respect to the following controlled substances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a narcotic set out in subitems 1(1) or (10), 2(1), 5(4) or 10(1) of Schedule 1; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled drug set out in item 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 2, items 9 and 10 of Part 2 of that Schedule, or item 1 of Part 3 of that Schedule.

Heading.TitleText: Application and General Conditions for Activities

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 156 to 188, the terms pharmacist, pharmacy technician, intern and health professional, as defined in subsection 1(1), and practitioner, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Act, are to be read as only including those who are practising in a hospital, except as otherwise provided.
A person in charge of a hospital may permit another person to conduct an activity with respect to a controlled substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case that the other person is a health professional, they are authorized by the provincial professional regulatory authority to conduct that activity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the other person conducts that activity as part of their duties and functions.

Section.MarginalNote: Orders placed on behalf of hospital
Section.Text: A person in charge of a hospital may only permit the following persons to order a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, on the hospital’s behalf:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner.

Subsection.Text: A hospital may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a licensed dealer if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensed dealer is specialized in destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the hospital first receives from that licensed dealer specialized in destruction a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other controlled substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the following conditions is met:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the licensed dealer is the one that sold or provided that controlled substance to the hospital, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the hospital sells or provides the controlled substance for the purposes of testing or destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the hospital first receives from the licensed dealer a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A hospital may sell or provide a restricted drug to a licensed dealer if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the restricted drug was previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is specialized in destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the hospital first receives from that licensed dealer specialized in destruction a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: The information that must be contained in the written order is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the licensed dealer, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital, its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance sold or provided for the purposes of destruction, a statement to that effect.

Subsection.Text: A hospital may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a pharmacist, other than one who is practising in a hospital, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale or provision is in the case of an emergency; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the hospital first receives from the pharmacist either a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information or a verbal order:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with respect to the pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with respect to the hospital, its name and municipal address,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the order,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration from the pharmacist that they require the controlled substance for emergency purposes.

Subsection.Text: A hospital must not sell or provide to the pharmacist a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the pharmacist’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.
A hospital may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to a practitioner, other than one who is practising in a hospital, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale or provision is in the case of an emergency; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the hospital first receives from the practitioner either a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the following information or a verbal order:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with respect to the practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with respect to the hospital, its name and municipal address,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the order,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration from the practitioner that they require the controlled substance for emergency purposes.

Subsection.Text: A hospital must not sell or provide to the practitioner a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the practitioner’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.

Subject to subsection (2), a hospital may, in the case of an emergency, sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to another hospital if the hospital first receives from the other hospital a written order that is signed and dated by a person permitted to place an order on the other hospital’s behalf and that contains the following information or a verbal order from such a person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other hospital placing the order, its name and municipal address, as well as the name and title of the person placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital selling or providing the controlled substance, its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration from the person placing the order that the other hospital requires the controlled substance for emergency purposes.

Subsection.Text: A hospital may, in circumstances other than an emergency, sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to another hospital if the hospital is ceasing its operations and if the hospital first receives from the other hospital a written order that is signed and dated by a person permitted to place an order on the other hospital’s behalf and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the other hospital placing the order, its name and municipal address, as well as the name and title of the person placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital selling or providing the controlled substance, its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A hospital may sell or provide a controlled substance to the Minister if the hospital first receives from the Minister a written order that is signed and dated on the Minister’s behalf and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the individual signing the order, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance is to be delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital, its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A hospital may sell or provide a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to an individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale or provision is for the individual’s own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner first issues a written or verbal prescription for the individual for whom, or the animal for which, the controlled substance is sold or provided.

Section.Text: A hospital may administer a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, to an individual or animal if a practitioner first issues a written or verbal prescription.

Subsection.Text: A hospital may compound a finished product, other than one containing a restricted drug, if it is for the purpose of fulfilling a prescription and,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the finished product is compounded at the request of a practitioner, that practitioner first issues a written or verbal prescription; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the finished product is compounded at the request of one of the following persons, in the case of an emergency, the hospital first receives from that person either a written order that is signed and dated and that contains the information set out in subsection (2) or a verbal order:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist who is not practising in that hospital or another hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner who is not practising in that hospital or another hospital, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: another hospital, if the order is placed by a person permitted to place an order on its behalf.

Subsection.Text: The information that must be contained in the written order is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person placing the order,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are a pharmacist, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are a practitioner, their name and the name and municipal address of the place where they practise, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is another hospital, its name and municipal address, as well as the name of the person permitted to place the order on its behalf;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the hospital receiving the order, its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration that they require the finished product for emergency purposes or, in the case of another hospital, a declaration from the person placing the order that the other hospital requires the finished product for emergency purposes.

Section.Text: A hospital that sells or provides a controlled substance or that compounds a finished product may, before the sale, provision or compounding, substitute a controlled substance for another controlled substance identified in a prescription, if it is authorized to do so under the laws of the province where the sale, provision or compounding takes place.
A hospital that receives an order from a person for a controlled substance must verify the person’s name and, if applicable, their title as well as their signature if it is not known to the hospital.

A hospital that receives a controlled substance from an individual for the purposes of destruction must keep the substance in a collection container that is in a secure location to which only persons whom it has authorized have access and that is marked in a manner that is sufficient to identify the container.
A hospital that stores a controlled substance must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the controlled substance is stored in a secure location in the hospital; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: only persons whom it has authorized have access to that secure location.

Section.Text: A hospital may deliver, send or transport a controlled substance.
A hospital that delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance to another person may only do so if it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensures that, if the controlled substance is being delivered, sent or transported to a licensed dealer specialized in destruction, the substance is placed in a container that is sealed in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal and is marked in a manner that is sufficient to identify the container;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: takes all reasonable measures to ensure the security of the controlled substance while it is being delivered, sent or transported; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: uses a method of delivery, sending or transportation that ensures the tracking of the controlled substance until the consignee receives it.

Section.Text: A hospital must take all reasonable measures to ensure the security of any controlled substance in its possession.

Section.MarginalNote: Loss or theft — agent or mandatary

Subsection.Text: If an agent or mandatary of a hospital becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, the agent or mandatary must notify the hospital immediately.

If a hospital becomes aware of a loss or theft of a controlled substance, or is notified by an agent or mandatary of such a loss or theft, the hospital must provide a written report to the Minister within 10 days after the day on which it becomes aware of the loss or theft or is notified.

The report, or any evidence derived from it, is not to be used or received to incriminate the hospital or its agent or mandatary in any criminal proceeding against them other than a prosecution under section 132, 136 or 137 of the Criminal Code.

The destruction of a controlled substance in a hospital may only be carried out, subject to subsection (2), by the person in charge of the hospital, a pharmacist, a pharmacy technician or a practitioner and if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is witnessed by another person among the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, pharmacy technician or intern,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other health professional, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the person in charge of the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: immediately following the destruction, the person who carried out the destruction and the witness sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the controlled substance was destroyed, to which each signatory must add their name in printed letters.

Subsection.Text: A health professional may, without a witness, destroy the remainder of a controlled substance, other than a restricted drug, that is contained in an open ampule and that will not be administered.

A hospital must, if the destruction of a controlled substance previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction was not carried out, sell or provide the substance to a licensed dealer specialized in destruction.

Section.Text: A hospital that receives a controlled substance, other than one that has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person receiving the controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person from whom the controlled substance is received, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.MarginalNote: Substances sold — persons other than individuals
Section.Text: A hospital that sells or provides a controlled substance to a person, other than an individual referred to in section 177, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person selling or providing the controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person to whom the controlled substance is sold or provided, their name and, if applicable, title, as well as their municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale or provision;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the reason for the emergency sale or provision.

Section.Text: A hospital that sells or provides a controlled substance to an individual for their own use, for the use of another individual or for an animal, or that administers a controlled substance to an individual or an animal, must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person selling, providing or administering the controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual who is named in the prescription or who is responsible for the animal identified in the prescription and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale, provision or administration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A hospital that compounds a finished product must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person compounding the finished product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual who is named in the prescription or who is responsible for the animal identified in the prescription and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription, as well as the name and municipal address of the place where they practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of compounding; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity.

Section.Text: A hospital that substitutes a controlled substance for another controlled substance identified in a prescription must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who carries out the substitution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the original prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the substitution;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the controlled substance identified in the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the substitute controlled substance.

Section.Text: A hospital that receives a written order for a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person receiving the order; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order and the date on which it was received.

Section.Text: A hospital that receives a verbal order for a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person receiving the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the person placing the order,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, municipal address and, in the case of another hospital, the name of the person permitted to place the order on its behalf, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration that they require the controlled substance for emergency purposes or, in the case of another hospital, a declaration from the person placing the order that the other hospital requires the controlled substance for emergency purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of receipt of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its drug identification number, if any.

Section.Text: A hospital that delivers, sends or transports a controlled substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the agent or mandatary of the hospital delivering, sending or transporting the controlled substance, their name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled substance is delivered, sent or transported to another person, the following information with respect to that person:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is not a person referred to in subparagraph (ii), their name and, if applicable, title, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they are an individual who is named in a prescription or who is responsible for an animal identified in a prescription, their name and, if applicable, the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place where the controlled substance will be delivered, sent or transported;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the delivery, sending or transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the means of transportation used;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name, form and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its form, strength and quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iv), its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Section.Text: A person who destroys a controlled substance in a hospital must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the witness to the destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3, its name and quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iii), its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (iii), its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the finished product has been previously returned by an individual for the purposes of destruction, only the identifier marked on the collection container of the finished product and the number of collection containers.

Heading.TitleText: Recording Information and Retention and Provision of Documents

Section.Text: Any person who records any information under sections 175 to 183 must do so using a method that permits an audit of it to be made at any time.
A hospital or, if a hospital ceases its operations, the person who was responsible for those operations on the date those operations ceased must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any document containing the information that is required to be recorded under sections 175 to 183 is kept for two years after the day on which the last record is recorded in the document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: every written order and prescription is kept, in sequence as to date and number, for two years after the day on which it is received or issued respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: every declaration and report is kept for two years after the day on which it is provided or received.

Section.Text: The documents must be accessible

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the hospital where the information was recorded; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that hospital has ceased its operations, at a place in Canada.

Section.Text: The documents must be complete and readily retrievable and the information in them must be legible and indelible.

A hospital or, if a hospital has ceased its operations, the person who was responsible for those operations on the date those operations ceased, must provide any documents that the Minister requests in the time and manner that the Minister specifies.

Heading.TitleText: Authorizations and Conditions Applicable to Activities

Subsection.Text: The Minister may sell or provide a controlled substance to a practitioner that the Minister has named in a letter of authorization.

The Minister must not sell or provide to the practitioner a controlled substance that is the subject of a prohibition on the practitioner’s professional practice imposed by the provincial professional regulatory authority.

Section.Text: The Minister may sell or provide a controlled substance to a person that the Minister has exempted under subsection 56(1) of the Act with respect to that substance.
The Minister may deliver, send or transport a controlled substance.
The Minister may import a controlled substance that is intended to be sold or provided to one of the following persons:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner named in a letter of authorization; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person exempted under subsection 56(1) of the Act with respect to that substance.

Section.Text: The Minister may export a controlled substance.

Heading.TitleText: Provision of Information to Third Parties

Section.MarginalNote: Provincial government or regulatory authority — entitled persons

Subsection.Text: The Minister may provide in writing any factual information that has been obtained under the Act or these Regulations about a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner or any other health professional to any relevant provincial government or to any provincial professional regulatory authority of a province in which the person is or was entitled by that authority to practise their profession, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the government or authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the person’s name and municipal address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the government or authority;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the person has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contravened these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the provision of the information is necessary to assist the government or authority in monitoring the person’s professional conduct for compliance with the laws of the province for the purpose of protecting public health or safety.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Provincial government or regulatory authority — persons not entitled
Subsection.Text: The Minister may provide in writing any factual information that has been obtained under the Act or these Regulations about a pharmacist, pharmacy technician, practitioner or any other health professional to any relevant provincial government or any provincial professional regulatory authority of a province in which the person is not entitled by that authority to practise their profession, if the government or authority submits to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a written request that sets out the person’s name and municipal address and a description of the information being requested; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document that shows that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the government or authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the person is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Section.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of verifying whether an importation or exportation of a controlled substance complies with these Regulations, provide the following to a customs officer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information provided in the permit application under section 34, 42, 205 or 213;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information listed on the permit under subsection 35(1), 43(1), 206(1) or 214(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information provided in the declaration under section 39, 47, 210 or 218; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information concerning the suspension or revocation of an import or export permit.

Section.Text: The Minister may provide to the International Narcotics Control Board any information that is obtained under the Act or these Regulations if the provision would allow Canada to respect its international obligations in relation to controlled substances.

The Minister may, for the purposes of the administration or enforcement of the Act or these Regulations or if it would allow Canada to respect its international obligations in relation to controlled substances, provide to a competent authority

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information obtained from a licensed dealer that has applied for or that holds an import or export permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information relating to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an import or export permit, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an activity specified on a dealer’s licence held by a licensed dealer that has applied for or that holds an import or export permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any document that the holder or former holder of an import or export permit is required to retain, including any document that relates to the dealer’s licence that the dealer holds or held; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any import or export permit.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, by order, add to Part 3 of Schedule 4 to these Regulations any item or portion of an item listed in Schedule V to the Act.
The Minister may, by order, delete any item or portion of an item from Part 3 of Schedule 4.

An item or portion of an item listed in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to these Regulations is deemed to be deleted on the day on which the equivalent item or portion of an item is no longer listed in Schedule V to the Act.

Section.Text: A government laboratory may produce a controlled substance.
A government laboratory may sell or provide a controlled substance to a licensed dealer.
A government laboratory may sell or provide a controlled substance to the Minister.
A government laboratory may sell or provide a controlled substance to another government laboratory.
A government laboratory may deliver, send or transport a controlled substance.
A government laboratory may import or export a controlled substance if it does so in accordance with an import or export permit issued under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A government laboratory must submit to the Minister, before each importation of a controlled substance, an application for an import permit that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the government laboratory’s name and municipal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the proposed customs broker for the government laboratory, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation is anticipated and the proposed date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address, in the country of export, of the exporter from whom the controlled substance is being obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the carrier that is proposed to transport the controlled substance to the customs office where the importation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Text: in the case of a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its CAS registry number, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its form,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its purity and anhydrous content, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)

Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture or finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its form, its strength, the number of containers and, if applicable, the number of units per container, and

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the person in charge of the government laboratory; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that, to the best of their knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the importation does not contravene the laws of the country of exportation or any country of transit or transhipment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete.

Subsection.Text: The government laboratory must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, which must be not later than 180 days after its effective date; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A person must not alter or deface in any manner an import permit.

Section.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 211 or 212, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the expiry, suspension or revocation of the export authorization that applies to the controlled substance to be imported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of export.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the government laboratory has not provided the Minister with the information or documents required under subsection 205(3) or before the date specified in the written request referred to in that subsection, or the information or documents that it has provided before that date are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the government laboratory has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that a controlled substance could be diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue an import permit, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the government laboratory with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the government laboratory an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the government laboratory’s submissions, if applicable.

Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of importation.

Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the government laboratory an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the import permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
The Minister must revoke an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the government laboratory requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the government laboratory does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph 211(2)(c) by the specified date; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the government laboratory submitted misleading information or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit.

Paragraph.Label: (a)

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the government laboratory’s submissions, if applicable.

Section.Text: A particular person may sell or provide a controlled substance to a licensed dealer, pharmacist or police force for the purposes of destruction.
A particular person may deliver, send or transport a controlled substance to a licensed dealer, pharmacist or police force for the purposes of destruction.

An individual who has obtained, in accordance with the provisions of the Act and its regulations, a controlled substance identified in a prescription for another individual named in that prescription may deliver, transport, sell or provide the substance to that individual.

An individual who has reasonable grounds to believe that a controlled substance in their possession was obtained in accordance with the provisions of the Act and its regulations may, for the purposes of destruction, deliver, transport, sell or provide the substance directly to one of the following persons:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist or pharmacy technician, other than one who is practising in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner, other than one who is practising in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a particular person.

Section.Text: On entering Canada, an individual may import a substance containing a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3 that is in their actual possession or that forms part of their baggage if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is importing the substance

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for their own use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use and on the behalf of an accompanying individual, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for administration to an animal for which the individual is responsible and that is accompanying the individual;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is declared to a customs officer at the port of entry into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the substance, except a finished product referred to in subsection 98(2) that contains low-dose codeine phosphate, is in a container obtained from a health care provider and that container carries a label on which the following information appears:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the individual for whom, or the animal for which, the substance was lawfully obtained,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the health care provider who authorized the substance to be obtained,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: with respect to the substance,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its name or, if applicable, brand name,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its form, strength and quantity, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: its drug identification number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the daily dose of the substance authorized by the health care provider; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the imported quantity of the substance does not exceed a 90-day supply required to treat a condition, based on the daily dose shown on the label.

Section.Text: On departing Canada, an individual may export a substance containing a controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 3 that is in their actual possession or that forms part of their baggage if
