Section.Text: Only sections 1, 7 to 33 and 228 to 234 apply to a test kit.
The following persons are required to obtain a registration number for a test kit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person that intends to produce a test kit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person for whom another person, in accordance with a custom order, intends to produce a test kit.

Subsection.Text: An application to obtain a registration number for a test kit must be submitted to the Minister and contain the following information with respect to the test kit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of its design and construction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the controlled substance set out in any of Schedules 1 to 4 and any other substance it contains, their names, forms and quantities;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of its proposed use; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its directions for use.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the person authorized by the applicant for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Subject to section 231, on completion of the review of the application for a registration number, the Minister must issue to the applicant a document that sets out a registration number for the test kit, preceded by the letters “TK”, if the Minister determines that the test kit will only be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.
A person must not alter or deface in any manner the document that sets out the registration number.
The Minister must refuse to issue a registration number for a test kit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit poses a risk to public health or safety, including the risk that the controlled substance in the test kit could be diverted to an illicit market or use, because

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the total amount of the controlled substance is too high, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit is not likely to prevent or deter the consumption of the controlled substance in the test kit by an individual or animal or the administration of that substance to an individual or animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit will be used for a purpose other than one referred to in subsection 230(1).

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue a registration number, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the applicant with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the applicant’s submissions, if applicable.

Section.Text: A person must inform the Minister in writing of any of the following facts within 30 days after their occurrence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person has ceased to conduct all activities authorized under section 234 with respect to the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person has transferred the production of the test kit to another person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person has increased the quantity of the controlled substance in the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person has changed the brand name of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the person has altered in any manner the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit or changed the quantity of either agent in it; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the person has substituted the adulterating or denaturing agent with another one.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel the registration number of a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister receives a notice from the person to whom the document that sets out the registration number was issued, stating that production of the test kit has ceased; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that one of the circumstances referred to in paragraph 231(1)(a) or (b) exists.

Subsection.Text: Before cancelling a registration number, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the person to whom the document that sets out the registration number was issued with a prior written notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consider the person’s submissions, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: The following rules apply when the registration number of a test kit is cancelled:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a test kit produced before a cancellation under paragraph (1)(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the activities set out in section 234 remain authorized, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number must remain on the label of the test kit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a test kit produced either before or after a cancellation under paragraph (1)(b), the registration number must not be displayed on its label.

Subsection.Text: Any person, other than a person referred to in subsection (2), may possess, sell, provide, transport, send, deliver, import or export a test kit if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subparagraph 233(3)(a)(i), the registration number of the test kit has not been cancelled under subsection 233(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit will be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit carries a label on which the following information appears:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number of the test kit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test kit that is not subject to the labelling requirements set out in the Medical Devices Regulations,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name and municipal address of the person that produced the test kit or, if the test kit is produced in accordance with a custom order, of the other person for whom the test kit was produced, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its brand name.

Subsection.Text: A person referred to in section 2 may possess a test kit.

Section.Text: A person that advertises a controlled substance may only do so if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is not a restricted drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the advertisement is directed to a person that is not part of the general public; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a written advertisement,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the advertisement appears in a document distributed to, or in a trade publication for,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a licensed dealer,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a pharmacist, pharmacy technician or practitioner, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a hospital, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the advertisement contains, in a conspicuous place, a legible and intelligible statement that the substance is a controlled substance.

Heading.TitleText: Notification of an Application for an Order of Restoration

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 24(1) of the Act, the prior notification of an application for an order of restoration given to the Attorney General must be made in writing and provided by registered mail at least 15 days before the date on which the application is to be made to a justice.
The prior notification must specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the justice to whom the application is to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time and place at which the application is to be heard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details concerning the controlled substance or other thing in respect of which the application is to be made; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence on which the applicant intends to rely to establish that the applicant is entitled to possession of the controlled substance or other thing referred to in paragraph (c).

Section.Text: [Amendments]
The following regulations are repealed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Narcotic Control Regulations2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Regulations Exempting Certain Precursors and Controlled Substances from the Application of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act3;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations4; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations5.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on October 1, 2026.
